instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_TCK: What is SMC_TCK? SMC_TCK is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDI: What is SMC_TDI? SMC_TDI is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDO: What is SMC_TDO? SMC_TDO is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots half way, stops,  then turns off
threads.message:
Have a coffee damaged 2936. Got green light, fan spin after replacing components. Still boots, then pauses and shuts down. Components near the edge, <RESISTOR>R4510</RESISTOR>, <CHIP>U5410</CHIP>, <CAPACITOR>C5411</CAPACITOR> and the <SIGNAL>ISNS_HS_OTHER_N</SIGNAL> circuit, seemed to have most of the corrosion. Further, the resistors <SIGNAL>SMC_KBC_MDE</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_TDO</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_TCK</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SMC_TDI</SIGNAL> were all replaced due to corrosion. All the resistors in the area check out, and no shirt to ground. Any idea? Anyone?

Also, one of the RAM cards was wrecked.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots half way, stops,  then turns off
threads.message: Did you try to boot from an external drive?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots half way, stops,  then turns off
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots half way, stops,  then turns off
threads.message: Try SMC bypass, does it power on???? Also check continuity between the parts you've changed, maybe broken trace...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> boots half way, stops,  then turns off
threads.message: I suspect bad RAM or crap in the RAM slots. But could be 100 other things...
